p: The need to build community resilience has been brought to the fore in Indonesia since the launch of the Hyogo Framework for Action (HFA) in 2005 [ 25]. Following its launch, the notion of “resilience” has been widely used in policy documents related to disaster management. In Jakarta, disaster resilience is stated as the central theme of the Provincial Disaster Management Planning 2013–2017 document [ 50]. Despite this, there is no common definition of resilience amongst stakeholders involved. Furthermore, study regarding priority needs in building community resilience to tackle flood risks remains limited.
